metadata.title: Test definition
metadata.description: Test description

notes.note: This is a note about the test

criterion.comment: Simple test (checks to see if we are running on i686

metadata.title: PL4 Compliance tests
metadata.description: Tests related to PL4 compliance

notes.note: For clip machines each of the following tests should pass

metadata.title: Needed packages for CLIP
metadata.description: Packages required for CLIP

notes.note: For clip machines each of the following tests should pass
These packages are required to do things such as build policy

metadata.title: GEN000020
metadata.description: Ensure single-user mode requires a password for login

criterion.comment: Ensure single-user mode requires a password for login (GEN000020)

metadata.title: GEN000400
metadata.description: Ensure a logon banner is displayed

notes.note: This test needs to be done manually until a way to do tst:2001 can be found.

criterion.comment: Ensure that the login-banner is correct

metadata.title: GEN000460
metadata.description: system-auth contents and authconfig permissions

criterion.comment: Ensure that system-auth is not modified

metadata.title: GEN000480
metadata.description: ensure there is a fail-delay of 4 seconds for login attempts

metadata.title: GEN000500
metadata.description: ensure that there is a 15 minute timeout for shells

metadata.title: GEN000540
metadata.description: Ensure passwords changed not more than once a day.

metadata.title: GEN000560
metadata.description: Ensure all users have a password or their shell is /dev/null

criterion.comment: Ensure that all users have a password

metadata.title: GEN000580
metadata.description: Ensure passwords contain a minimum of eight chars

metadata.title: GEN000600
metadata.description: Ensure passwords contain at least 2 alpha charachters, one of which must be capitalized

criterion.comment: Ensure correct cracklib line exists in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

metadata.title: GEN000700
metadata.description: Ensure passwords are changed at least every 60 days

criterion.comment: Ensure passwords are changed every 60 days.

metadata.title: GEN000800
metadata.description: Ensure passwords are not re-used within the last 5 changes

criterion.comment: Ensure correct cracklib line exists in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

metadata.title: GEN000920
metadata.description: Ensure ~root has permission 700

metadata.title: GEN000980
metadata.description: Ensure that root can only log in from the console. (ensure /etc/securetty contains only console)

metadata.title: GEN001020
metadata.description: Ensure that users requiring root privs log in and then su to root

criterion.comment: Check that sshd uses sshd uses pam_access.so
Check that login uses sshd uses pam_access.so
Ensure that access.conf only allows users in group users to login

metadata.title: GEN001080
metadata.description: Ensure that root's shell is not located in /usr if /usr is partitioned

criterion.comment: Ensure that root's shell is not located in /usr if /usr is partitioned
Check if /usr has its own partition

metadata.title: GEN001120
metadata.description: ensure that root cannot log in through ssh

criterion.comment: Ensure that root cannot login via ssh

metadata.title: GEN001260
metadata.description: Ensure log files have permissions of 640 or more restrictive

criterion.comment: ensure uexec permission is off in log files
ensure gexec permission is off in log files
ensure gwrite permission is off in log files
ensure oexec permission is off in log files
ensure oread permission is off in log files
ensure owrite permission is off in log files

metadata.title: GEN001280

metadata.title: GEN001380
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/passwd has permissions of 644 or more restrictive

criterion.comment: ensure uexec permission is off on /etc/passwd
ensure gexec permission is off on /etc/passwd
ensure gwrite permission is off on /etc/passwd
ensure oexec permission is off on /etc/passwd
ensure owrite permission is off on /etc/passwd

metadata.title: GEN001400
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/passwd and /etc/shadow are owned by root

metadata.title: GEN001420
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/shadow has permissions 400

metadata.title: GEN001460
metadata.description: Ensure all home directories in /etc/passwd exist

criterion.comment: Ensure all users in passwd have home dirs

metadata.title: GEN001580
metadata.description: Ensure that all rc scripts are 755 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN001620
metadata.description: Ensure that all rc scripts do not have the SUID or SGID bit set

metadata.title: GEN001660
metadata.description: Ensure that all rc scripts are owned by root

metadata.title: GEN001680
metadata.description: Ensure that all rc scripts group is one of {root, sys, bin, other, (system default)}

metadata.title: GEN001720
metadata.description: Ensure that global init files (/etc/{profile,bashrc,environment}) are 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN001740
metadata.description: Ensure that owner of global init files (/etc/{profile,bashrc,environment}) is root

metadata.title: GEN001760
metadata.description: Ensure that group of global init files (/etc/{profile,bashrc,environment}) is {root, sys, bin, other, (system default)}

metadata.title: GEN001780
metadata.description: Ensure that global init files (/etc/{profile,bashrc}) contain the line "mesg n"

metadata.title: GEN001800
metadata.description: Ensure that all filesin /etc/skel are 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN001820
metadata.description: Ensure that all files in /etc/skel are owned by root or bin

metadata.title: GEN002040
metadata.description: Ensure that .rhosts .shosts hosts.equiv and shosts.equiv are not used (Ensure they are linked to dev null

criterion.comment: Check for existence of hosts.equiv in /etc
Check for existence of rhosts.equiv in /etc

metadata.title: GEN002120
metadata.description: Ensure that /etc/shells exists

metadata.title: GEN002160
metadata.description: Ensure that no shell has the setuid bit set. /bin/([a-z]*sh|nologin)

criterion.comment: ensure no shell has suid bit set.

metadata.title: GEN002180
metadata.description: Ensure that no shell has the setgid bit set. /bin/([a-z]*sh|nologin)

criterion.comment: ensure no shell has sgid bit set.

metadata.title: GEN002200
metadata.description: Ensure that the owner of all shells is root or bin (set to root by ks)

criterion.comment: Ensure all shells owned by root or bin

metadata.title: GEN002220
metadata.description: Ensure that all shells have permissions of 755 or more restrictive.

criterion.comment: Ensure all shells are 755 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN002320
metadata.description: Ensure the audio devices have permissions of 644 or more restrictive

criterion.comment: Ensure audio devices are 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN002340
metadata.description: Ensure the owner of audio devices is root

criterion.comment: Ensure audio devices are owned by root.

metadata.title: GEN002360
metadata.description: Ensure the group of audio devices is (root|sys|bin)

metadata.title: GEN002420
metadata.description: Ensure user filesystems, removable media, and remote filesystems are mounted nosuid

criterion.comment: Ensure user filesystems, removable media, and remote filesystems are mounted nosuid

metadata.title: GEN002560
metadata.description: Ensure the system and user umask is 077 (umask line in bashrc, csh.cshrc)

metadata.title: GEN002640
metadata.description: Ensure the logon capability of default system accounts (for redhat UID -lt 500) is disabled by making the default shell /dev/null

criterion.comment: Ensure the logon capability of default system accounts is disabled by making shell /dev/null

metadata.title: GEN002660
metadata.description: Configure and implement auditing.

metadata.title: GEN002680
metadata.description: Ensure the audit datafiles and directories are readable only by personal authorized by the IAO (default owner only, set /var/log/audit to 0700)

criterion.comment: ensure audit datafiles and dirs are readble only by authorized personel. (Set /var/log/audit to 0700

metadata.title: GEN002700
metadata.description: Ensure audit datafiles have permissions of 640 or more restrictive. (/var/log/audit/* /etc/audit/audit.rules )

criterion.comment: ensure /var/log/audit/* have perms of 640 or more restrictive
ensure /etc/audit/audit.rules has perms of 640 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN002720
metadata.description: Ensure failed attempts to access or open files are audited.

metadata.title: GEN002740
metadata.description: audit dac changes

metadata.title: GEN002760
metadata.description: Audit admin, priviledged and security actions

metadata.title: GEN002820
metadata.description: Audit system administration actions

metadata.title: GEN002860
metadata.description: Ensure audit logs are rotated daily.

metadata.title: GEN002980
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/cron.allow has permission 600 or more restrictive

criterion.comment: ensure /etc/cron.allow has perms of 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003040
metadata.description: Ensure owner of crontabs is root or the creator

metadata.title: GEN003060
metadata.description: Ensrure default system accounst (except root) will not be listed in the cron.allow file, if there is a cron.deny file, the default accounts (except root) will be listed there.

metadata.title: GEN003080
metadata.description: Ensure crontabs have permissions of 600 or more restrictive (700 for some Linux crontabs as per UNIX checklist)

metadata.title: GEN003100
metadata.description: Ensure cron and crontab directories of 755 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003120
metadata.description: Ensure owner cron and crontab directories is (root|bin)

metadata.title: GEN003140
metadata.description: Ensure owner cron and crontab directories is (root|sys|bin)

metadata.title: GEN003180
metadata.description: Ensure cron logs have perms of 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003200
metadata.description: cron.deny has perms 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003240
metadata.description: owner and group of cron.allow is root

metadata.title: GEN003260
metadata.description: owner and group of cron.deny is root

metadata.title: GEN003300
metadata.description: at.deny is not empty

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/at.deny is not empty or that it does not exist.

metadata.title: GEN003320
metadata.description: at.allow system default accounts not in it (except root)

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/at.allow does not contain bin sys or adm.

metadata.title: GEN003340
metadata.description: at.{allow,deny} perms 600 or more restrictive

criterion.comment: ensure perms at.{allow,deny} 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003400
metadata.description: /var/spool/at/spool dir perms 755 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003420
metadata.description: owner and group /var/spool/at/spool dir root:root

metadata.title: GEN003460
metadata.description: owner and group /etc/at.allow root:root

metadata.title: GEN003480
metadata.description: owner and group /etc/at.deny root:root

metadata.title: GEN003500
metadata.description: Core limit is set to 0 in /etc/profile. It would be better to use the ulimit command to get the max size of a running system, but at this time oval does not allow spawning processes like that.

metadata.title: GEN003520
metadata.description: owner and group of core dump data dir root:root with perms 700 or more restrictive (/var/crash)

metadata.title: GEN003600
metadata.description: Ensure net parameters are securly set. (md5sum of /etc/sysctl.conf)

metadata.title: GEN003660
metadata.description: Ensure *.info is in /etc/syslog.conf

metadata.title: GEN003700
metadata.description: ensure inetd (xinetd for linux) is disabled if all (x)inetd services are disabled (chkconfig xinetd off) A number of services were turned off for this test. FIXME: figure out a good way of checking chkconfig

criterion.comment: Check if any of xinetd services are enabled
Check if any of xinetd is running

metadata.title: GEN003740
metadata.description: Ensure xinetd.d locked down (755 /etc/xinetd.d, 440 /etc/xinetd.d/*, 440 /etc/inetd.conf)

metadata.title: GEN003760
metadata.description: Owner of /etc/services (root|bin)

metadata.title: GEN003780
metadata.description: /etc/services 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN003860
metadata.description: ensure fingerd is off

metadata.title: GEN003960
metadata.description: ensure owner /bin/traceroute root

metadata.title: GEN003980
metadata.description: ensure group /bin/traceroute root

metadata.title: GEN004000
metadata.description: ensure perms /bin/traceroute 700 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN004360
metadata.description: ensure owner /etc/aliases root

metadata.title: GEN004380
metadata.description: ensure perms /etc/aliases 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN004440
metadata.description: ensure /etc/mail/sendmail.cf log level no lower than 9

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/mail/sendmail.cf has a log level greater than or equal to 9

metadata.title: GEN004480
metadata.description: Ensure owner /var/log/maillog root

metadata.title: GEN004500
metadata.description: Ensure perms /var/log/maillog 640 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN004540
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/mail/helpfile empty, ensure sendmail.cf help off (md5sum to prevent tamper)

criterion.comment: ensure /etc/mail/sendmail.cf does not specify a helpfile.

metadata.title: GEN004560
metadata.description: Ensure sendmail greeting message sanitized (md5sum /etc/mail/sendmail.cf to prevent tamper)

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/mail/sendmail.cf does not print the version in the SmtpGreeting.

metadata.title: GEN004580
metadata.description: Ensure .forward files not used (~user/.forward)

metadata.title: GEN004640
metadata.description: Ensure decode entry in /etc/aliases is disabled

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/aliases does not contain an uncommented decode line

metadata.title: GEN004880
metadata.description: Ensure ftpusers file exists

metadata.title: GEN004900
metadata.description: Ensure ftpusers file containts usernames of users not allowed to use FTP and contains at minimum root and pseudo-users

metadata.title: GEN004920
metadata.description: Ensure owner /etc/ftpusers root

metadata.title: GEN004940
metadata.description: Ensure perms /etc/ftpusers 640 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN005000
metadata.description: Ensure ftp account shell is /dev/null

criterion.comment: Ensure the logon capability of ftp system account is disabled by making shell /dev/null

metadata.title: GEN005360
metadata.description: Ensure owner group of /etc/snmp/snmpd.conf is root:sys

criterion.comment: Check if any snmpd.conf files exist

metadata.title: GEN005400
metadata.description: Ensure owner perms of /etc/syslog.conf is root/640 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN005420
metadata.description: Ensure group of /etc/syslog.conf is root, sys, or bin

metadata.title: GEN005500
metadata.description: Ensure ssh v1 is not used, nor compatibility mode

metadata.title: GEN005600
metadata.description: Ensure ip forwarding is disabled if the system is not a dedicated router

criterion.comment: Ensure /etc/sysctl.conf does not do ip forwarding.

metadata.title: GEN005740
metadata.description: Ensure owner /etc/exports is root

metadata.title: GEN005760
metadata.description: Ensure perms /etc/exports is 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006100
metadata.description: Ensure owner of /etc/samba/smb.conf is root

metadata.title: GEN006120
metadata.description: Ensure group of /etc/samba/smb.conf is root

metadata.title: GEN006140
metadata.description: Ensure perms of /etc/samba/smb.conf is 644 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006160
metadata.description: Ensure owner of /usr/bin/smbpasswd is root

metadata.title: GEN006180
metadata.description: Ensure group of /usr/bin/smbpasswd is root

metadata.title: GEN006200
metadata.description: Ensure perms of /usr/bin/smbpasswd is 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006260
metadata.description: ensure perms of /etc/news/hosts.nntp is 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006300
metadata.description: ensure perms of /etc/news/nnrp.access is 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006320
metadata.description: ensure perms of /etc/news/passwd.nntp is 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006340
metadata.description: Ensure owner of /etc/news/* (recursive) is root

metadata.title: GEN006360
metadata.description: Ensure group of /etc/news/* (recursive) is root

metadata.title: GEN006380
metadata.description: Ensure /etc/news/hosts.nntp.nolimit 600 or more restrictive

metadata.title: GEN006520
metadata.description: Ensure security tools and databases have perms 740 or more restrictive (/etc/rc.d/init.d/iptables, /sbin/iptables, /usr/share/logwatch/scripts/services/iptables)

metadata.title: GEN006620
metadata.description: Ensure hosts.allow and hosts.deny files are used

metadata.title: LNX00320
metadata.description: Ensures that unnecessary unpriviledged users are not in /etc/passwd

criterion.comment: Ensures that unnecessary unpriviledged users are not in /etc/passwd

u:uname_test.comment: This is a test test test.

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure single-user mode requires a password for login (GEN000020)

i:unknown_test.comment: Ensure that the login-banner is correct. How do we do this without downloading the latest version of the banner during testing.

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure that login attempts are audited
Ensure that accounts are locked after 3 failed login attempts
Ensure 'FAIL_DELAY[ ]+4' in /etc/login.defs
Ensure 'readonly TMOUT=900' in /etc/profile
Ensure 'PASS_MIN_DAYS\t1' exists in /etc/login.defs
Ensure that all users have a password
Ensure 'PASS_MIN_LEN\t8' exists in /etc/login.defs
Ensure correct cracklib line exists in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

u:shadow_test.comment: Ensure that the maximum number of days for a password to exist is less no more than 60

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure correct cracklib line exists in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Ensure that root cannot login via ssh

u:file_test.comment: ensure perms at.{allow,deny} 600 or more restrictive

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure /etc/profile sets the max core size to 0

ensure sendmail.cf does not specify a helpfile

u:password_test.comment: Ensure the logon capability of ftp system account is disabled by making shell /dev/null

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure /etc/ssh/sshd_config does not use version 1
Ensure /etc/sysctl.conf has no ip forwarding
Ensure /etc/hosts.deny is not tampered with.

u:password_test.comment: ensure accounts shutdown, halt, reboot, and who dont exist
ensure news, operator, games, gopher, nfsnobody don't exist

u:process_test.comment: Ensure all X servers were run with the auth and audit options.

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Ensure /etc/inittab does not allow for the ctrl+alt+del key sequence
Ensure /etc/cups/cupsd.conf has Classification mls
Ensure net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
Ensure net.ipv4.tcp_max_syn_backlog >= 1280 in /etc/sysctl.conf
Ensure net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0 in /etc/sysctl.conf
Ensure net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1 in /etc/sysctl.conf
Check if /usr has its on partition
Check if any xinetd services are enabled

i:unknown_test.comment: Ensure all users in passwd have home dirs.

i:textfilecontent_test.comment: Check if sshd is using pam_access.so
Check if login is using pam_access.so
Check to ensure only users group users can log in

u:file_test.comment: Ensure .forward files do not exist on the filesystem

u:uname_object.comment: The one uname object to rule them all

i:textfilecontent_object.comment: Ensure that password is a minimum of 8 charachters
Ensure that correct cracklib line exists

u:shadow_object.comment: Ensure that password must be changed after 60 days

i:textfilecontent_object.comment: make sure the last 5 passwords cannot be reused
ensure umask 077 exists in bashrc csh.cshrc

u:password_object.comment: shutdown, halt, sync, ftp account not exist
news, operator, games, gopher, nfsnobody account not exist

i:textfilecontent_object.comment: returns the audit.rules syscall checks for 32bit syscalls
returns the audit.rules syscall checks for 64bit syscalls
Ensure that stime reboot acct and swapon ops are audited
Ensure that settimeofday setrlimit and setdomainname ops are audited
Ensure that sched_setparam and sched_setscheduler ops are audited
Ensure that chmod fchmod chown chown32 and fchown ops are audited
i:textfilecontent_object.i:line: -a exit,always -S chmod -S fchmod -S chown -S chown32 -S fchown

i:textfilecontent_object.comment: Ensure that sched_setparam and sched_setscheduler ops are audited
Check if access.conf only allows users
Find any line in mtab nosuid

constant_variable.comment: Values that are possible for group_id in /etc/{profile,bashrc,environment}
Values that are possible for group_id in /etc/services
